location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Map of Persia indicating the extent of the Anglo-Persian Oil Company concession

mods.abstract: The map indicates the territory of the Anglo-Persian Oil Company’s concession in Persia [Iran] until 31 December 1938, south of a line drawn on the map which is labelled the ‘violet line’. The map is referred to in article 2 of the oil accompanying concession text (f 131). Also indicated on the map are: the coastlines of the Caspian Sea and Persian Gulf, with islands drawn and labelled in the latter; the Karun river [Rūd-e Kārūn]; major towns and cities; the Persian border.
